What are some important details about the latest Verus software update, and what are VerusIDs in the context of the Verus protocol?

The latest Verus software update includes several notable changes. Firstly, it is essential to be aware that some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" due to its mining capabilities. This is a false positive, and users can refer to resources from Malwarebytes and Kaspersky for more information.

In terms of updates, the Verus software now allows for the optional use of VRSC or VRSCTEST chains as a parent of an ID. For example, an ID like "bob@" is equivalent to "bob.vrsc@" or "bob.vrsctest@" on the testnet. The update also includes improvements to the stratum protocol for mining, which enables smooth autoswitching and prepares for the upcoming PBaaS merge mining feature.

Additionally, the update addresses some minor issues, including a listidentities issue on Mac and compatibility with pool mining, even for block numbers under 16.

Furthermore, this update is mandatory to remain on the Verus mainnet, as the protocol will hardfork at block 800200. It is crucial to upgrade to this version to avoid needing to resynchronize the blockchain if running in native mode.

Regarding VerusIDs, they are not just an ID system but a fully functional blockchain protocol. Unlike many other blockchain ID implementations, there is no corporation involved in the protocol. VerusIDs provide a wide range of opportunities for identity applications, including quantum-ready friendly crypto-addresses on the worldwide Verus network, full decentralization, revocability, recoverability, privacy, and power.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
# Notable Changes
* Enable optional VRSC or VRSCTEST chains as parent of an ID. For example, bob@ is equivalent to `bob.vrsc@` or, on testnet, `bob.vrsctest@`
* Update stratum protocol for mining to include solution information for miner, which enables smooth autoswitch and prepares for PBaaS merge mining
* Minor issues, including listidentities issue on Mac and compatibility with pool mining, even on block numbers under 16 to prepare for PBaaSThis release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustment to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm**AT BLOCK 800200, THE VERUS MAINNET PROTOCOL WILL HARDFORK, AND THIS UPDATE IS MANDATORY TO REMAIN ON THE VERUS MAINNET.
